title: 108_hr1466
content: The Act titled "Mobilized Reserve Family Health Care Act of 2003" provides reduced health insurance costs for family coverage of military reservists called to active duty through a refundable credit for costs up to TRICARE costs. The Mobilized Reserve Family Health Care Act of 2003 offers a tax credit for insurance covering medical care for eligible individuals, limited to TRICARE costs during active duty periods. The credit does not apply to self-only coverage for reservists. The tax credit under the Mobilized Reserve Family Health Care Act of 2003 does not apply to self-only coverage for eligible individuals who are members of the National Guard or reserve components of the Armed Forces called to active duty for over 30 days. The credit also cannot be used to determine other deductions or credits. The tax credit under the Mobilized Reserve Family Health Care Act of 2003 does not apply to self-only coverage for eligible individuals who are members of the National Guard or reserve components of the Armed Forces called to active duty for over 30 days. Amendments are made to section 1324(b) of title 31, United States Code, and the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Section 223 of the Internal Revenue Code allows for a deduction for certain family coverage health insurance costs of military reservists called to active duty. The deduction under Section 223 of the Internal Revenue Code allows eligible individuals to deduct the amount paid for medical care insurance for themselves, their spouse, and dependents during active duty. Special rules apply, such as no deduction for self-only coverage and other rules similar to section 162(l) apply. The deduction is allowed whether or not the individual itemizes. The deduction under Section 223 of the Internal Revenue Code allows eligible individuals to deduct certain family coverage health insurance costs of military reservists called to active duty. The deduction is allowed whether or not the individual itemizes other deductions. The amendments made by Section 223 allow for the deduction of family coverage health insurance costs for military reservists called to active duty, effective for taxable years starting after December 31, 2002.
